ZDEg45W4cvtTQGRMzsP4tQ.text: The Bottom Line: A simple, straightforward Thai restaurant that'll leave you satisfied.The setting is pretty nice, and the food satisfying. Their curries were the standout, and the rest of the party enjoyed their meals. I recommend it for a business lunch.

RjWyDz0S94QuIsFjHhOHAQ.text: There is usually a super long queue for all the restaurants on the work days in Marina Bay... so unless you're going early or after 1pm, expect a wait. The food here is good and there is a nice variety of dishes on their menu. I've had their Pad Thai, which is how I gauge most Thai restaurants, and it's nice and flavorful. I've been here a few times and I can't say I've ever been disappointed. It's a solid choice for lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Pandan Rice with Chicken and Peanut Satay Sauce
Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Glass Noodle Salad with Chicken and Seafood

fbYf8g4fHuiTy3r_GkKHbQ.text: We looked for vegetarian foods and they have a separate veg menu. The food was great. Fresh and tasty with little sugar added.

photos.caption: Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore

l6qux3GcDbajoaibu-ZFDg.text: What a disappointment - ordered masaman beef (Sgd 18.05 don't ask about the 5 cents ) But then when I got it I'm not sure if it could be called like that. Beef stripes instead nice chunkier beef. Beef was cooked oddly to must have been soften in some brine. The steamed rice was a small handful cup. And the sauce was so sweet and awful I drew most of the stuff away. Nothing made sense with this dish except the color.

pqT6ML6UAXjcVdAHBQTcbw.text: We got here at 11:30a and there was no line and the restaurant was empty. However, when we left at 12:15p, there was quite the line outside!I got the RED CURRY DUCK and it was not bad, but not great. The texture of the current was interesting; I think it felt a little powdery. The duck was a bit hard. I was hoping the duck would be nice and tender. The presentation was pleasant and the taste was pretty good. (I would eat the duck curt from OSHA Thai over this one any day).I'm quite disappointed that they didn't serve brown rice. The white rice was nothing special; just your typical white rice at the restaurant. The price is expensive for the quality of meal. $20 for curry and rice, but this is the CBD so that's expected I guess.

photos.caption: Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore. RED CURRY DUCK on white rice.

2TPmxvfZl6qLKLk-PdSG7A.text: Pretty standard for thai food. The tom yum soup along with all the other dishes was legit spicy.

photos.caption: Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Absolute Thai - Singapore, Singapore. Basil chicken

CFZZMJyUWSVLoLDHuR35Fg.text: This is probably the worst Thai food I've so far eaten in Singapore. I've eaten here twice now (God help me, I don't learn) and both experiences have been lackluster. This isn't even about authenticity, the food just simply tasted bland.On the most recent occasion, my dining party ordered four dishes: the red chicken curry, the minced chicken with basil, the fish cakes and some veggies.The basil dish is my favourite Thai dish (and I would normally eat it with minced pork but this was not available) and I have tried many versions over the years in many places. This is probably the worst version I have ever tried. It doesn't need much description: bland. It lacked spice, taste & anything interesting. Same goes for the red curry, it tasted watered down and lacked coconut milk or any interesting texture. The chicken was overcooked to the max.Basically, avoid this place. The Marina Bay area is not known for its food but you can still do better than this.

iT6eLuO10sbk8GsG3nlR7Q.text: I like Absolute Thai for take out since we leave in the area.  I enjoy the pad thai, mango rice and banana leaf chicken.  this thai food will not set the world on fire but they are quick, have good quality and is not too expensive.
